Converting Archive Files

After you upgrade a server configuration created with StarTeam 6.0 or earlier to StarTeam 2005 or StarTeam 2005 Release 2, it uses the Native-II vault for all new files put under application control. However, it continues to use the old Native-I vault for existing application files.

At some point, you will want to convert your Native-I archive files to Native-II.  The conversion can be performed as a background process from the Server Administration dialog or manually from the Windows or Cross-Platform client. When you convert a Native-I archive file to Native-II, you can choose to delete the Native-I file. If it is not deleted, it is moved to a new subfolder of the Native-I vault Archive folder named ConvertedArchives.

Borland recommends that you do a backup operation before converting your files. However, the conversion process must not be running during a backup operation. If you have scheduled the conversion process to run at specific times, check your scheduling program to be sure that the conversion is not scheduled to run during the backup.

Important: The Server sends an e-mail notification to members of the System Manager group after the vault conversion is finished. By default, no members are in the System Managers group, so you should add users to this group before the conversion process completes.

To convert  Native-I files as a background process:

  1. On a computer where the Server is installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server. The Server Administration dialog appears.

  2. Select a server configuration. If you are not logged on already, you will be asked to do so.

  3. Select Actions > Start Conversion on the menu or click the Start Conversion icon on the toolbar. These features are available only if the configuration contains one or more Native-I archive files.

    4. The Start Conversion dialog displays. You can stop the conversion at any time by selecting the Actions > Stop Conversion menu option or the Stop Conversion icon. These options appear after you have started a conversion.

  4. On the Start Conversion dialog, select the Delete old archives after successfully converting them checkbox if you wish to retain a copy of the files in Native-I format.

  5. Click OK to start the conversion process, which will run in the background. You can run the process until all of the files have been converted or stop it, at your convenience.

    6. Note: If the application determines that the server configuration does not yet have at least one hive, it will ask you to create one with the Hive Manager before converting the files.

  6. To stop the conversion process (for example, during periods of high server activity), return to the Server Tools dialog and click Stop Conversion. You can restart the conversion again when it is convenient.

To convert selected files manually from the client:

  1. In a client, select the files you wish to convert.

  2. Select File > Advanced > Convert Archive. This action displays the Convert Archives dialog.

  3. Select one of the following options:

    • Keep old archives

    • Delete old archives after successful conversion

  4. Click Convert.

    5. Note: To convert files manually, you must have access rights that allow you to perform remote configuration administration.

For more information, see the StarTeam Administrator’s Guide.
